metadata.title: CVE-2019-6488 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description: The string component in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through2.28, when running on the x32 architecture, incorrectly attempts to use a64-bit register for size_t in assembly codes, which can lead to asegmentation fault or possibly unspecified other impact, as demonstrated bya crash in __memmove_avx_unaligned_erms insysdeps/x86_64/multiarch/memmove-vec-unaligned-erms.S during a memcpy.

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
